action.primary: Tonifies Kidney Yang and astringes Jing

indications: Kidney Yang Deficiency with lower back pain, tinnitus, impotence, premature ejaculation, urinary frequency or incontinence and vaginal discharge

action.primary: Nourishes Liver Blood and improves vision

indications: Diminished visual acuity or blurred vision from Liver Blood Deficiency

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency with Heat signs.
Contraindicated for those with hyperactive sexual drives.
Contraindicated for those with difficult urination.
Contraindicated for those with excessively frequent erections and an inability to ejaculate.

useCases: Impotence, premature ejaculation, enuresis, incontinence and vaginal discharge.
Chronic spermatorrhea, enuresis, fatigue, lower back pain or vaginal discharge from Kidney and Liver Deficiency.
Low back pain from severely deficient Liver and Kidneys.
Blurred vision from Deficient Liver and Kidneys.
Blurred vision in patients with Deficient Kidney and Liver Yin.

Tonifies the Liver and Kidneys to ensure that the eyes are nourished, anchors Liver Yang and expels Wind-Heat to treat many eye disorders, especially when there is Liver and Kidney Deficiencies with either Liver Qi Stagnation with Liver Yang Rising or External Wind-Heat affecting the eyes.
Blurred vision due to Deficient Liver and Kidney Yin.
General Kidney Deficiency with leakage of Jing.

notes: This herb used when a person’s health is deteriorating rapidly.
It helps conserve Jing and restore strength to the lower body.
It is from a different species than Rx. Astragali Huang Qi.
It Astringes Jing and urine and benefits Jing and marrow.

Other than treat#{Bai(Ci)JiLi} ing the eyes, Sha Yuan Zi and Fr. Tribuli #{BaiJiLi} Bai Ji Li are completely different in appearance and actions. Bai Ji Li dredges the Liver and expels Wind to brighten the eyes with no tonifying effect. Sha Yuan Zi tonifies the Liver and Kidneys to brighten the eyes. They are often used together to treat eye diseases.

Sha Yuan Zi Fr. Lycii #{GouQiZi} Gou Qi Zi, and Sm. Cuscutae #{TuSiZi} Tu Si Zi all tonify the Kidney Yin and Yang and are often used together. Gou Qi Zi better nourishes Kidney and Lung Yin, slightly tonifies Kidney Yang and tonifies Liver Blood to improve vision. Tu Si Zi and Sha Yuan Zi both tend toward the Yang and astringe Jing.

Dry-fried Complanate Astragalus Seed Chao Sha Yuan Zi is better able to tonify the Kidneys and astringe Jing to treat urinary frequency, vaginal discharge, spermatorrhea and premature ejaculation due to Kidney Yang Deficiency.

Salt-prepared Complanate Astragalus Seed Yan Sha Yuan Zi goes directly to the Kidney channel and strongly tonifies the liver and Kidneys to treat headache, dizziness, tinnitus, deafness and aching weakness of the lower back and knees. Do not use if these symptoms are the result of Kidney Yin Deficiency with Empty Heat .
